column10: Please describe the incident in your own words
column16: Were weather conditions a likely factor?
column22: Would you be willing to share your contact information with local authorities?
column27: Select one or more NoVA FSS Charters to subscribe to communications:
column28: Do you want to use the same contact information as above?
column33: How did you hear about us?
column34: Please let us know where you heard about us?

column10: A white ford pickup, smaller than F150 did a U-turn at Roberts and Guinea, over shooting the U-turn and drove up onto the sidewalk, nearly hitting myself, dog, another female walker and the wall. This is not the first time that particular truck has done this. Also, cars trying to beat the left hand turn from New Guinea onto Roberts will overshoot the turn and end up on the sidewalk.
column21: This seems to be a re-curring issue that happens every 2 months or so, that I witness. I have seen other complaints, though, as well for the same things.
